headline: Sweet Potato Pie
description: Shared from a Southern recipe, this homemade sweet potato pie is easy to make with boiled sweet potato. Try it, it may just be the best you've ever tasted!

video.description: This is a satisfying Southern dessert that's perfect in fall and winter.
video.name: Sweet Potato Pie I

name: Sweet Potato Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Place whole sweet potato in pot and cover with water; bring to a boil. Boil until tender when pierced with a fork, 40 to 50 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Remove sweet potato from the pot and run under cold water. Remove and discard skin.
Break sweet potato flesh apart and place in a bowl. Add butter and mix with an electric mixer until well combined.
Add sugar, milk, eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon, and vanilla; beat on medium speed until mixture is smooth.
Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool before serving.

review.reviewBody: Used can potato instead of fresh came out great. Will definitely make it again
I baked the sweet potatoes instead of boiling them. My pie had to bake longer than the recommended time. Delicious pie. Thank you!

The first one I made seemed to need salt, making it again with salted butter, also salted the water that I boiled the potatoes in. Fingers crossed. Update: 2-6-23 used salted butter and salted the water I cooked the potatoes in, made all the difference. Delicious 🤤
It turned out amazing. So good, in fact, i'm making another one

This was excessively sweet to me. Also took much longer to bake. Next time I will only do 1/2 cup brown sugar and cut down on the vanilla extract. There’s no salt in this so maybe that is why it is so sweet? I also whipped my egg whites which I think improved the consistency.

Offering An Important Step! This is a great taste. I've been making these pies for years. But for anyone new a making sweet potato pie... I need to share a very important step to ensuring that your pies are the best ever! There are tons of fibers in yams and sweet potatoes and if you do not extract them from your filling, your guests will get a mouth full of strings - YUCK! I learned that when I was new at pie making. So... blend and then clean your beaters under water and then blend for a second time. Trust me... it will make a difference.

This is my first try at making sweet potato pie. It was good, but, I substituted 1/2 & 1/2 instead of milk. When I make it again, I would use 1/4 cup of sugar. I had decreased it to 1/2 cup, but find that it's still too sweet for my taste. In general, I find many recipes call for too much sugar, and in this case, sweet potatoes are already sweet. I suggest using less sugar, as they say "less is more" (flavor).

Baked my fresh yams skins on for caramelized sweetness. Added ground cloves, allspice, with the nutmeg and cinnamon. Used eggnog instead of half and half with one egg. Smells delicious coming out of the oven soon.

I didn't have fresh sweet potatoes on hand so I used canned yams. I ended up having to add a bit more of each ingredient. It's taking a little longer to bake ,but I expected that. So far, so good. Smells WONDERFUL! I also ended up using an entire 2lb. can of the yams.

I microwaved my sweet potatoes until they were cooked. The 2 pies I made I used graham cracker crusts. The pies were so delicious, everyone who had a piece said that it was the best part of my entire dinner!
Not a huge sweet potato fan but had some sweet potatoes on hand so I tried the recipe…3 times now. Very good! I also whipped the egg whites

This was my first time baking a sweet potato pie and it was delicious! I read another recipe that said to bake the sweet potatoes because it concentrates the flavor and sweetness, so I did. I also used half and half and added an extra egg because I had 3 in the carton and they were near the best by use date. Also, I weighed my yams on a scale after I peeled off the skin and used slightly more than 1 pound (not sure if I read that on this site or elsewhere). My brother and son loved it! I'll be making another one later on in the week.

I’ve made this recipe a bunch of times now. It’s become very popular. I did take the liberty to tweak it a little bit. First, I use just over a pound (1.13 to 1.24 lbs) of sweet potato or yam. In fact, I’ve come to find that doing half sweet potato and half yam is the best. I also use the skins in my pies. Just cut them up into small pieces. Second, I have been using a 10 inch graham cracker pie crust. Keebler makes one and it tends to be pretty good. Especially if you’re not making your own. Third, I use a half cup of light brown sugar instead of one cup of white sugar. I also add 1/4 teaspoon of all-purpose white flour and 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda because the brown sugar adds moisture. But my last pie I added a 1/2 teaspoon of King Arthur’s pancake mix instead of flour and baking soda. Fourth, I use my hand mixer with the regular beaters to mix it very well. Then I switch the the whisks and mix it for another 30 seconds da to a minute. Then back to the regular beaters for a little bit more. I do t know why I do this, but it just seems right. 🤷🏼‍♂️
I made no changes and the pie turned out great! Everyone loved it 😊
Very easy and simple! Every one loved it!!
Used this recipe twice and both times were a success!

Wonderful recipe! My family loved it! I did have to bake it for almost 2 hours for the filling to set like it needed to. I just added time to the baking, 15 minutes at a time, until it was done. I also measured out 2 cups of mashed sweet potatoes, to make sure there was enough in the mix. This was just right Yummy pie!!
Delicious 😋
I cut the butter to 1/4 cup and pie came out perfect!

I made this recipe. I used twice as much sweet potato so I could make two pies but two pounds of sweet potato was not quite enough. I used half as much sugar (we don't like super sweet things) and I used three eggs but I used all the suggested amounts of everything else for one pie except we didn't have vanilla extract. Having said all of that, this was super easy to make once the potatoes were boiled, cooled and skinned. The filling took twice as long to set. I had to bake the pies for two hours. Final verdict: Delicious. Simply delicious. MUCH better than you can buy in the grocery store and more flavorful than a pumpkin pie. I also made whipped cream from scratch. This is my go-to recipe for Thanksgiving pie from now on. Five stars.
The pie was so good ,family were impressed, I even made my own butter crust.

I love this recipe and I would not change it. When I make it I use 2 lbs of sweet potatoes and 2 and a half of cups of sugar it's not overly sweet and it comes out beautifully. Plus I've been using this recipe since 2009 and it's the only recipe I use
My 1st time making a sweet potato pie and it turned out great

As a black man I love my sweet potato pie. This recipe is a great base to start with. I’ve been tweaking it for 7 years and I’ve come quite close to perfection. I add triple the spices and use half brown and white sugar. Also evaporated milk. I mix 3 tbs. Of cake flour to the milk before adding it to the mix for added texture. And I separate my egg whites and beat them before adding as well. Thx for this recipe it’s helped me tremendously.

This is an easy recipe for a terrific Sweet Potato Pie! I love it. Family loves it. And, I thank you for it. I do cheat a little. I'm by the steamable sweet potatoes. They come in a one and a half pound bag at Walmart. They actually are ready to be peeled within 8 minutes and it makes the prep for this pie the easiest prep for any pie I've ever done.
LOVE!!!
I love this recipe. I have been using for about 7 years. Made a few tweaks to it over the years to make it more diabetic friendly. Still haven't got it quite right yet. It's still a hit though.
Very good recipe!!!

Some tips for those with loose fillings- Bake the potatoes instead of boiling. If the pie filling looks soupy, mix in 1-2 Tbsp of flour. Cover edges with foil, bake up to 15 additional minutes. Let pie rest at least an hour before cutting. This is a really good basic sweet potato pie. You will need to make it your own with your tweeks. I use brown sugar, more cinnamon and 1/8 tsp allspice. My mom liked to add ginger. Make it your own!

CALIBRATE YOUR OVEN TEMPERATURE!! This recipe is perfect, our pie was delicious. For those whose pie turns out too loose or seems under cooked it could be your oven temperature which is set for say 350 deg, when really isn't 350 deg. The actual temperature could be higher or lower. A couple years ago I learned that most ovens can (should) be calibrated. Read your owners manual on 'calibrate your oven'

This is a great basic recipe! You can play with your ingredients a lot and make it your own. Try cooking the potatoes different ways (I bake them), using different sugars or mixes of (I like brown), use your own spice mix (I add fresh ginger), and even try different breeds of sweet potato.
I'm not the sweet potato pie queen of the universe, but this recipe is a keeper. Better than any pumpkin pie I've eaten. It keeps calling you back for more.

I have never made (or liked) Sweet Potato Pie but I married a Georgia man, so instead of asking a friend to make it for him, I decided to tackle it myself this year!!! This recipe was so easy and the pie came out amazing. I did double the spices because I used 3 potatoes and i used condensed milk instead of whole milk. This is the perfect recipe!!!
My family asks me to make it every Thanksgiving
My family loves a sweet pie, so I added 1 can of sweetened condensed milk and 1/2 cup of brown sugar. Very good
I loved it . Great recipe. Highly recommended.
I added two additional eggs and a half of a cup of brown sugar.
Great recipe. I used this recipe for the filling and Betty Crocker for the crust. I also used white sweet potatoes. Yummy and everyone like it with dinner and one also had another slice for dessert
Substituted 1/2 C Monk Fruit for sugar, skim milk, land o lakes cinnamon butter spread, and a pecan crust.

This recipe was great, however make sure everything is at room temperature before it goes in the mixer, lessen the sugar, and cool it overnight before eating. Use these tips if your pie comes out too wet.
Don't boil the sweet potate instead baked has more flavor, if you boil them the water take away the flavor

This recipe is easy and delicious. I increased the spices just a smidge and reduced the sugar to 3/4 cup. The only other thing I did different was bake it longer. Even after an extra 30 mins my knife did not come out clean but I took it out of the oven then.
I have been using this recipe for 35 years it is perfect! I don't eat pumpkin pie but I absolutely love this sweet potato pie! You cannot go wrong with this recipe.

I just found this recipe and have already made this twice! It is so good, but of course, I put my own touch to it. I used evaporated milk and added more spice. We love cinnamon so I added just a touch more of the spices. YUM
I’ve made this pie every year at fall for the past few years. It’s NEVER disappointed (a couple of people have asked me to make it for them instead of a birthday cake)!!
Easy recipe. Taste fantastic! We boiled the sweet potatoes 3 days prior stored them in the refrigerator. Microwaved for 3 minutes to take the chill out then started the recipe.
So simple. Follow directions and it will come out perfect
Brilliant!!!!!my name is Tiger,I am 69 years old,I made some the senior citizens they love it.
Great recepie. Simple and fast. A hit with my picky eaters.
I made it according to the recipe with the exception of making the pie crust myself. It came out phenomenal!

This was a really great recipe, but I did make quite a few alterations the second time around. To combat the thinnesses of the batter, I put 1.5lbs of sweet potato. I ran it through a strainer to get all the stingy bits out. Next I only put in 1/2 a cup of sugar as the potatoes added more than enough sweetness. I am a fan of bold flavors so I did double the amount of cinnamon and nutmeg, I also added 1/2 tsp of clove, and and a tsp of ginger. To thicken it up a bit more, I did add 1 more small egg or 1/2 an egg if you don’t have a small one, and a tablespoon of flour slowly sifted into the mix. I also added a dusting of sugar on the top to make a nice thin sugar shell on top.
Turned out beautifully😊😊😊😊

This was an easy recipe. Boiling the sweet potatoes took the longest. The instructions were simple and easy. No strange ingredients that I had to search for. The mix looked too thin so I added more sweet potato and it was a little too much for the pie crust. When I took it to my friend, he LOVED it. He ate the whole pie in two days! I have never made a pie before and if I can do it, anyone can!
I used carnation milk instead of whole milk

Very good and delicious. They only thing I would recommend is for 1 pie you need 2 cups of mashed sweet potatoes. Also like everyone else is saying it's a little too sweet. I would do 3/4 sugar and add 1/4 teaspoon of salt. This will definitely make it taste perfect. Enjoy.

Used 1/2 white sugar half cup brown. Used 1/4c butter and 1/4 c homemade sour cream in place of 1/2 c butter. Fyi! If you peel potatoe and cut into chunks b4 boiling it only takes about 15 minutes to cook! Fabulous! I also added 1 tbs corn starch to prevent pie from being too loose!
My siblings usually hate sweet potato, but they loved this recipe! I made it two times already and I can't stop eating it all alongside my sister. Definitely a hit!
First time making a pie looks good can't wait till done.
It's good because it's simple. The same recipe as my mom's who was a cook/chef from the south except for her secret ingredient. You will enjoy this pie.
I was concerned that it looked a little wet, so I did add some flour. Also I went with 1/2 brown sugar 1/2 white sugar. It was greatly!
Delicious 😋
The pie used whole milk1/2 cup but I used 1/3 cup of half & half it came out great
It was very good!
White Sweet Potatoes!!! Yummy
Loved it
Easy and delicious...
Easy and tasty
If my husband has his way, he'd have me make this for him every week It's so smooth and flavorful And so easy to make I usually have to make 3 at a time so the kids and grandkids can get some too!
I like it very much. It's not hard and not a lot of ingredients. The pie turned out great. I plan to make more, God willing.
Loved it no chances
This was really good, will make again. I used heavy cream instead of milk for a richer flavor.
love it the best one yet
I didn't add the butter, and I used light brown sugar, versus white sugar. It looks perfect, and preliminary tasting iwas omg good
I have been making this recipe for a dessert and for holidays and it’s a big hit!! It’s so delicious!!

I'm from The Great State Of Mississippi, and we invented sweet potato pies (please don't tell my granny any different!)This is without a doubt, one of the best and easiest pies EVER!! My granny would be proud. Loved it, loved it.
I added extra half a teaspoon of nutmeg and vanilla

Well, the situation is is that one pound I asked Google is equal to how many cups of sweet potatoes and it turns out that when I mashed everything up it turned out exactly four cups like they're equivalent was then I did everything according to directions stuck it in I'm going to read the pie crust and it was just the right amount however it's already been over an hour and 15 minutes, and it's not done. How much longer do I have to cook this to make it solid?
I added a. Little more sugar cause I had more than a pound of sweet potatoes but the pie is excellent
I have made this a couple of times. It is my favorite. I use canned sweet potatoes. I also ct the sugar down to 3/4 cup. Just our preference. It is so easy and delicious
We loved the receipe . I didnt have fresh sweet potatoes and used instant sweet potatoes and it worked wonderfully.

The instructions didn’t say to use a deep dish pie so, I ended up with two regular pies. This pie is definitely easy to make and very tasty. Next time, I’ll make my homemade crust but, today was a day I needed short cuts. Also, it took longer to bake in my oven. It took an hour for these two pies
Delicious
Used whipping cream instead of milk. Everything else the same. Delicious!

Recommended! Easy, basic ingredients you'll always have on hand. I changed it up a by doing half cup brown sugar and half cup of white sugar. Always comes out great.
I've cooked the sweet potatoes (actually Red Garnet yams) in the oven and in the microwave. Microwave wins. After they cool overnight, one slice and the meat just falls away from the skin. I cook extra then bag and freeze it in 1 lb ziplocs.
Thanks for the recipe!

Love it! Followed recipe to the "t" the first time I baked it. And the fifth time I baked it I added a teaspoon of honey and heavy whipping cream and 2 tablespoons of sour cream and it tasted the same just a little more creamy. Both ways are delicious just depends on how creamy you want it
I used soy milk in place of regular milk and it turned out great.
I come from the deep south, this recipe is SECOND to none!

It was great! I used 3 lbs of sweet potatoes so I increased the ingredients. I did 1/2 tablespoon of each nutmeg, cinnamon, and vanilla, 1 stick of margarine or butter, 1 1/2 cup sugar and about 1/4 cup evaporated milk. This made three deep dish pies for my boyfriend!
great taste! a little too custardy, but a great taste!
I didn't know sweet potato pie could be so good, trust me make it!

This was the best sweet potato pie ever. I did half sugar and half brown sugar, added a few tablespoons of flour and baked my pie crust. Everyone that eat them said they were better than any they had ever tried. I would give this 10 stars out of 5....
I simply LOVE this recipe and everyone who eats this pie LOVES it too! I actually add 1/8 cup of Crown Peach to it to give it a little bit of southern peachiness to it and it's a hit.
Good, but too sweet. Sugar overpowers sweet potato flavor.
I made this sweet potato pie recipe for Thanksgiving and it turned out marvelously. Thank you!
I thought the recipe was a good one. The pie was delicious.
So good

This was a perfect basic Recipe tool for me to use. I ended up adding a 1/4 tsp of salt, more Vanilla Extract (1 Tbsp), and 2 tsps Bourbon Vanilla Extract. I used yams in place of the sweet potatoes for texture and taste preferences. I also made a cinnamon/sugar pie crust for my pie.
We loved it . I used half brown and half white sugar. I baked my potatoes. It was a hit!!!

What an adaptable recipe! We do Keto, so I had to make a few changes, but it was just as good as last year's.
1. Swerve sweetner 1/2 cup granulated, 1/2 cup Brown
2. Potatoes - microwaved them instead 
 of boiling - saved time and trouble. I 
 halved them - had 3 and they were the 
 very round kind. 1200 watt oven for 3 
 minutes x 3 times, but check for 
 doneness after each increment. Peeled 
 them when they cooled.
3. Used a refrigerated pie crust - we 
 weren't really going to eat it anyway.
4. Used 1/4 cup almond milk and 1/4 cup 
 heavy cream
5. Used my food processor for the whole 
 thing - SO EASY!
This recipe has always been so good, but I wasn't sure it would adapt to KETO -glad I tried it - it did not disappoint!
